Works for me on Windows I20060223-1656 and on Macintosh.  Could you be more specific about what you were doing when this happened?

I tried running the Find_System_Prints.em script at one point, and something appeared to be busy for a while, and I think the Task view popped into focus, but there wasn't anything in it that wasn't already there.  At that point, bringing up the menu showed me duplicate entries for Bjorn/Ward.  Picked one of those, and then the menu disappeared (from the menu bar).  Restarting eclipse will bring it back, but selecting the menu yields an empty menu, and then it disappears again.

My 3.2M5 workspace is fairly standard although quite large.  Don't think I have anything odd terribly odd installed.

I installed Monkey to a separate feature 'directory', like I do all features like this, to make it easy to enable/disable it, by enabling/disabling the directory in update mangler.  Disabling/restart/enabling/restart yields the same problem - menu is empty, then disappears.  WTP, XML Buddy, Zork Quicklaunch, Chris Grindstaff's coloring editor.

When I get a chance, I'll debug it ...
Just tried on a much cleaner 3.2M5 workspace, and everything seems to run fine.  Must be something in the other workspace ...

I figured out how to reproduce this.

Traverse the navigator to a 'monkey' directory, for example, the one provided by the existing plugin.  Context menu/New/File.  Type a file name with an .em suffix, for instance, tmp.em.  Press Finish.

Um, press Finish again.  (first hint that something is wrong)

Editor opens on your new empty .em file, and the Monkey menu has disappeared, or will become non-operational.

Paste the following comment into your .em file.

/*
 * Menu: tmp
 */

Save. Monkey menu returns.  Select the line with Menu: in it, delete it, save.  Monkey menu is dead.  Undo to put the line back.  Save.  Monkey menu lives.
